feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued November 21 at 10:32AM AKST until November 22 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: LOW PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHERN GULF OF ALASKA WILL INTENSIFY AS A LARGE STRONG STORM MOVES INTO THE SOUTHEAST GULF OF ALASKA THROUGH THURSDAY. DEEP COLD ARCTIC AIR OVER THE EASTERN INTERIOR WILL CONTINUE TO FLOW THROUGH THE PASSES OF THE CHUGACH MOUNTAINS IN RESPONSE TO THE LOW IN THE GULF OF ALASKA AND HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE INTERIOR.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 21 at 10:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKST FRIDAY... THE FAIRBANKS NORTH STAR BOROUGH AIR QUALITY PROGRAM HAS ISSUED AN AIR QUALITY ADVISORY FOR THE FAIRBANKS NORTH STAR BOROUGH...IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKST FRIDAY. CURRENT NORTH POLE AIR QUALITY IS CLASSIFIED AS UNHEALTHY...AND EXCEEDS THE EPA HEALTH LIMIT FOR FINE PARTICULATE POLLUTION.

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued November 21 at 4:42AM AKST until November 22 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...VERY WINDY CONDITIONS TO IMPACT THE SOUTHERN COASTAL AREAS THURSDAY... .A VERY POWERFUL STORM WILL BE MOVING INTO THE SOUTHERN GULF OF ALASKA ON THURSDAY. STRONG GUSTY WINDS WILL SPREAD INTO THE SOUTHWEST COASTAL AREAS THURSDAY. ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Southern Inner Channels

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 21 at 1:43PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGHER THAN NORMAL FLOW ON THE COLORADO RIVER THROUGH MOHAVE COUNTY AND ENTERING LAKE MEAD TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... THE DEPARTMENT OF INTERIOR HAS BEEN CONDUCTING A HIGH FLOW EXPERIMENTAL RELEASE FROM GLEN CANYON DAM NEAR PAGE ARIZONA. MONITORING STATIONS ALONG THE COLORADO RIVER IN MOHAVE COUNTY

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued November 21 at 1:00PM PST until November 23 at 3:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR BEACHES ALONG SOUTHERN SAN DIEGO COUNTY FOR THANKSGIVING... .A NORTHWEST SWELL ORIGINATING FROM THE GULF OF ALASKA IS BUILD TODAY AND EXPECTED TO PEAK THURSDAY...RESULTING IN ELEVATED SURF FOR WEST FACING BEACHES. SOUTHERN SAN DIEGO COUNTY BEACHES WILL SEE THE HIGHEST SURF DUE TO THE GREATER EXPOSURE TO THE NORTHWEST

entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued November 21 at 4:27AM EST until November 22 at 7:00PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK THROUGH AT LEAST THURSDAY EVENING FOR PALM BEACH AND BROWARD COUNTY BEACHES... .THE COMBINATION OF A NORTHER EASTERLY SWELL AND WIND SWELL MIX ALONG WITH MODERATE SURF HAS GENERATED STRONG RIP CURRENTS ALONG PORTIONS OF THE SOUTHEAST FLORIDA COAST AND WILL CONTINUE TO DO SO THROUGH AT LEAST THANKSGIVING.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued November 21 at 3:01AM EST until November 23 at 6:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... BREAKERS IN THE 3 TO 6 FEET RANGE AND A STRONG NORTH TO SOUTH LONG-SHORE CURRENT WILL CONTINUE TO PROMOTE A HIGH RISK

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued November 21 at 3:16PM CST until November 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: .VERY STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS ARE EXPECTED THANKSGIVING DAY BEHIND A COLD FRONT WHICH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY THANKSGIVING MORNING. THESE WINDS WILL REACH SUSTAINED SPEEDS OF 30 TO 35 MPG AT TIMES OVER PART OF THE AREA...WITH GUSTS AROUND 45 MPH. WINDS WILL DECREASE THANKSGIVING NIGHT BUT IT WILL STILL BE WINDY.

PERIODS OF SNOW WILL MOVE INTO THE NORTHWEST BY THIS AFTERNOON AND WILL SPREAD EAST AND SOUTH THROUGH THE DAY...LEADING TO AREAS OF SHARPLY REDUCED VISIBILITY IN SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW BY

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 2:55AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH FROM THE NORTH THIS EVENING...EXPECT A SUDDEN BURST OF RAIN AND SNOW WITH THE FRONT...QUICKLY CHANGING TO SNOW BEHIND THE FRONT. IN ADDITION...EXPECT A PERIOD OF VERY STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS WITH A FEW GUSTS NEAR 60 MPH POSSIBLE. THESE STRONG WINDS WILL COMBINE WITH THE PRECIPITATION TO CREATE DIFFICULT TRAVEL TONIGHT. THOSE WHO PLAN ON TRAVELLING THROUGH NORTHERN

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 2:55AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL INCREASE TODAY TO 30 TO 40 MPH WITH FREQUENT GUSTS OVER 60 MPH. THESE STRONG WINDS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE NIGHT WITH LIGHT SNOW POSSIBLE TOWARD MORNING. THOSE WITH OUTDOOR INTERESTS SHOULD PLAN ON RAPIDLY DETERIORATING CONDITIONS. THOSE WHO PLAN ON TRAVELLING WITH TRAILERS OR IN HIGH PROFILE VEHICLES SHOULD CONTINUE TO MONITOR ROAD CONDITIONS TODAY AND TONIGHT.
